title.narrative: Provision of protective education assistance for crisis-affected children and youth in Rakhine State

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to increase access to quality education that incorporates protection aspects to assure the safety of the learning environment for children across Rakhine State, particularly in Sittwe and Pauktaw. This proposed intervention will contribute towards enhancing educational support and capacity to deliver quality education in Rakhine, focusing on a protection-oriented approach inside and outside schools, including mobile activities for those locations with a high number of out-of-school children. Through the maintenance of existing Temporary Learning Classrooms (TLCs) and school facilities, coupled with capacity building aimed at education personnel (teachers / facilitators), the NRC aims to reduce the unmet needs, help children return to a normal routine, and contribute to children’s emotional security and positive cognitive and physical development. This education intervention will be holistic, incorporating psychosocial support, essential educational activities, and maintenance of structures, and will offer opportunities for both children in school and out of school to engage in learning and protective activities that will bridge toward more formalized education pathways. In collaboration with local authorities, an analysis of those areas most in need and identification of location with the highest number of out-of-school children will be developed during the inception phase of the project. Target beneficiaries will include in- and out-of-school girls and boys affected by the humanitarian situation in Rakhine, and male and female teachers / facilitators in the targeted locations. Protection mainstreaming will be guaranteed throughout the whole project and specific child protection cases will be referred to specialized agencies. The intervention is designed with consideration for the cultural context and how it may affect access for girls, children with different abilities / disabilities, and children of different ethnic groups. Intensive project sensitization activities and information campaigns will be conducted to change how girls and their families views the significance of education and allow them to re-imagine the benefits of allowing girls to participate, or continue participating, in Education.
